about_the_game:
Q: What should I do after entering the game?
Answer: Try clicking on the grid. Be careful not to hit the mines.

Q: How do I know if a square is a mine?
Answer: When you click on a grid, it will display a number indicating the number of mines within a 3*3 range. Based on these numbers you can calculate which tile has a mine.
Once you determine that a grid is a mine, you can right-click on that grid to put a flag on that grid to remind yourself that it is a mine.

Question: What is a stone?
Answer: Stones cannot be clicked. Nothing works, it just sits there quietly.

Q: What is sight distance?
Answer: When you turn on sight range 2, the number displayed in the grid will be the number of 5*5 mines, not 3*3.
When you turn on sight distance 3, it will be 7*7.

Q: What should I do after entering the game?
Answer: Try clicking on the grid. Be careful not to hit the mines.

Q: How do I know if a square is a mine?
Answer: When you click on a grid, it will display a number indicating the number of mines within a 3*3 range. Based on these numbers you can calculate which tile has a mine.
Once you determine that a grid is a mine, you can right-click on that grid to put a flag on that grid to remind yourself that it is a mine.

Question: What is a stone?
Answer: Stones cannot be clicked. Nothing works, it just sits there quietly.

Q: What is sight distance?
Answer: When you turn on sight range 2, the number displayed in the grid will be the number of 5*5 mines, not 3*3.
When you turn on sight distance 3, it will be 7*7.
name: Super MineSweeper

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows7
  • Processor: i3
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: RTX1060
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Sound Card:
  • VR Support:
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows10
  • Processor: i7
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: RTX1660
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 500 GB available space
  • Sound Card:
  • VR Support:

short_description: On the basis of MineSweeper, sight range and stones are introduced to solve the dead-end situation of traditional MineSweeper. There are fifty levels from simple to difficult. In the fiftieth level, there are many grids of 6, 7, and 8, but there must be a solution. Global racing rankings.
supported_languages:
English*, Simplified Chinese*
*languages with full audio support
